alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 9:30PM EST until December 24 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River from Elliston to Hazleton. East Fork White River at Seymour. .Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches from Friday night into Saturday caused minor flooding to develop along portions of the White River and the East Fork White River in southern parts of central Indiana. The crest on the White River is near Elliston with points downstream steady to slowly rising. The crest on the East Fork White River is near Seymour with flooding expected to end by late Wednesday. Flooding along the White River is expected to last until Christmas for points downstream of Newberry. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins to flood several Pike County roads. Many of the following county roads begin to flood around this level...east of SR 57 include CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E. Pike county road subject to flooding west of SR 57 include...CR 250 W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700 N...CR 1000w...CR 900W...CR 700W and CR 775W. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Sunday /7:30 PM CST Sunday/ the stage was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 17.7 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 1100 AM EST /1030 AM CST/.
